verses.verse: ((1 An exhortation to the Church to praise the Lord for his victory and conquest, that he giveth his Saints against all man’s power.) ) Sing ye unto the Lord a new song: let his praise be heard in the Congregation of Saints.

Let Israel rejoice in him that (In that they were preferred before all other nations, it was as a new creation, and therefore, Ps. 95:7, they were called the sheep of God’s hands.) made him, and let the children of Zion rejoice in their (For God as he is the creator of the soul and body, so wills he that both … serve him and that his people be continually subject to him, as to their most lawful king.) King.
Let them praise his Name with the flute: let them sing praises unto him with the timbrel and harp.
For the Lord hath pleasure in his people: he will make the meek glorious by deliverance.
Let the Saints be joyful with glory: let them sing loud upon their (He alludeth to that continual rest and quietness which they should have if they would suffer God to rule them.) beds.
Let the high Acts of God be in their mouth, and a two edged sword in their hands,

(This is chiefly accomplished in the kingdom of Christ when God’s people for just causes execute God’s judgments against his enemies: and it giveth no liberty to any to revenge their private injuries.) To execute vengeance upon the heathen, and corrections among the people:
To bind (Not only the people, but the kings that were their enemies should be destroyed.) their kings in chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron,

That they may execute upon them the judgment that is (Hereby God bindeth the hands and minds of all his to enterprise no farther than he appointeth.) written: this honor shall be to all his Saints. Praise ye the Lord.
